356c3fbf-462a-4bc3-91eb-6c85c8d314aa.description: The badge earner analyzes Culturally Responsive Teaching and Learning (CRTL) and core equity values. 8a959a6b-fa6d-4a66-a933-e7815004c011.description: The earner applies Universal Design concepts to the planning and design of online courses, defines accessibility, and applies pertinent Federal, State, and District requirements to the planning and design of online courses. The earner demonstrates the ability to create accessible content in the Learning Management System (LMS), Word, Google docs, PowerPoint, and/or PDF. Earner also captions videos and checks curated resources for accessibility using online tools.

4fdabe53-2c5e-4075-b95b-c4c3e93892eb.description: The badge earner applies research that connects humanizing and equity to their instructional content. They also develop inclusive community norms and a lesson plan for an online live session that uses effective instructional skills to support the diverse needs of community college students. The earner achieves these goals by asynchronously engaging with content and completing assignments in Canvas, as well as attending synchronous sessions in Zoom that scaffold their learning.

8a44f712-5de1-4f9a-966c-b80cf679ff96.description: The badge earner can implement AWS networking and firewall configurations; deliver secure, resilient products; design, create, and deploy applications using the AWS Console and Elastic Beanstalk; launch and monitor EC2 instances with the AWS Console; implement computing services in AWS; include AutoScale and load balance features; employ AWS Lambda Services to create Serverless tasks; configure AWS storage services using security best practices; designs and manages various databases in AWS.

This badge is recognized by our accreditation body at the American Culinary Federations Educational Foundation Accreditation Commission.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Blueprint Reading I (WELDG/E 124) course with a grade of C or higher.
Demonstrate reading blueprints on a final project at the apprentice level or higher.

46527b12-982c-4872-ba4e-4cd47c0bb10f.description: The earner of this badge examines the potential of culturally responsive teaching to support more students through the STEM academic pathway and critically reflects on their teaching practices. The earner uses digital technologies to foster trust and community. The earner reconfigures an existing online STEM course with eight humanized elements that support the affective dimensions of learning, foster an inclusive course climate, and provide a more equitable learning experience for all students.
46527b12-982c-4872-ba4e-4cd47c0bb10f.name: Humanizing Online STEM Academy

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Humanizing Online STEM Academy.
Complete all assessments all required skill competencies.

686ef566-e2ae-4579-997d-838c2d591931.description: The badge earner demonstrates knowledge and skills related to providing care for seniors related to health and the activities of daily living. The earner can measure vital signs, assist with ambulation, and perform Snellen eye chart exams. The earner documents medical information and has an understanding of basic nutrition and fitness essentials.
686ef566-e2ae-4579-997d-838c2d591931.name: Gerontology/Health

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of healthcare curriculum.
Completion of 54 hours of hands-on practice working with seniors

a9522ab5-0e3a-4cd9-92f2-b782a42f1568.description: Digital badge earner handles calls, appointments, scheduling, calendar, files, staff meetings, and events for offices on-site, remote, and virtual. Earner can complete memos, invoices, reports, and basic bookkeeping for a variety of clients, businesses, schools, and government agencies.
a9522ab5-0e3a-4cd9-92f2-b782a42f1568.name: On-Site, Remote & Virtual Office Assistant

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Computer Applications and Office Technology 001, 030, 082, and 101 with an overall grade point average of 2.5 for those courses.
Successful completion of all core labs with at least 75% in each lab activity.

122ea6b4-3920-4eca-a8d6-eb6f62d48fe3.description: The badge earner provides client services as it relates to barbering, customer relations, marketing, shaving, haircuts, draping and disinfection in preparation to take the Barbering License Exam. The earner completed 200 hours as required by California State Board of Barbering and Cosmetology Board as preparation to take the Barbering License Exam when currently licensed as a cosmetologist.
122ea6b4-3920-4eca-a8d6-eb6f62d48fe3.name: Barbering License Preparation

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the barbering cross-over course
Completion of 200 hours of clipper and shaving techniques beyond the current California Cosmetology License.
Satisfactory completion of practical and written exams.

2a726a25-b334-4811-91bf-9ba01b0d2e69.description: Badge earner demonstrates ability to use basic tools to make Canvas pages, assignments, and quizzes accessible for those with vision, hearing, and color challenges. ADA 508 compliance at WCAG 2.1 Level AA can be demonstrated for alternative text, captioned video, embedded links, color contrast, text size and style, tables, and page headers.
2a726a25-b334-4811-91bf-9ba01b0d2e69.name: Canvas Accessibility - Level 1

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Canvas Accessibility -Level 1 course with a passing score of 85% or higher.
Successful completion of all skills competencies at a score of 85% or higher.

98ad7663-0f21-4386-bdeb-976726506c90.description: Badge earner can provide care for infants and toddlers in a home or childcare setting. Earner can plan fun and interesting curriculum to engage infants and toddlers.
98ad7663-0f21-4386-bdeb-976726506c90.name: Child Care for Infants and Toddlers

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Infant and Toddler Development (CH DEV 030) and Toddler Care and Education (CH DEV 031) with a minimum grade of B or higher in each.
Successful completion of 10 hours of supervised experience providing 1 to 3 activities with Infants and Toddlers in a classroom setting.

367891f7-050d-4144-ad72-0f0200b17a8f.description: The badge earner can implement AWS networking and firewall configurations; deliver secure, resilient products; design, create, and deploy applications using the AWS Console and Elastic Beanstalk; launch and monitor EC2 instances with the AWS Console; implement computing services in AWS; include AutoScale and load balance features; employ AWS Lambda Services to create Serverless tasks; configure AWS storage services using security best practices; designs and manages various databases in AWS.
367891f7-050d-4144-ad72-0f0200b17a8f.name: LATTC Amazon Cloud Computing Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of four college courses, Computer Information Systems 192, 193, 194, and 195, with passing grades of C or better in each.

964c9695-1dd6-4494-897d-524982c700f9.description: The badge earner has demonstrated an understanding of the legal and ethical uses of information; ability to recognize copyright laws and fair use of information; ability to identify types of plagiarism and how to avoid it; and an understanding of the importance of citing.
964c9695-1dd6-4494-897d-524982c700f9.name: Legal & Ethical Uses of Information

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Legal and Ethical Uses of Information curriculum
Pass knowledge quizzes with scores of 80% or higher

d828ab4f-5581-4715-abf7-bf785ac2d25d.description: The badge earner demonstrates ability to handle front office duties such as answering phones, making and confirming appointments, patient check-in and discharge, ordering medical supplies, and handling patient payments.
d828ab4f-5581-4715-abf7-bf785ac2d25d.name: Medical Front Office

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Computer Applications and Office Technology 020. 044, and 082 with a grade of C or higher in each course.
Successful completion of all core assessments in each of the required courses at a level of 75% or higher.

b00865ed-25d6-48f7-8f3e-9d4f2ae068d8.description: The badge earner can demonstrate the ability to work collaboratively as a team member. The earner can demonstrate active listening and a variety of communication skills to solve problems and complete complex tasks in a professional manner. The earner demonstrates ability to resolve conflicts using critical thinking skills. Participated in the LAOCRC Regional Strong Workforce, L.A. Region Healthcare Pathway & Work Readiness Project led by Los Angeles Trade-Technical College.
b00865ed-25d6-48f7-8f3e-9d4f2ae068d8.name: Teamwork, Collaboration, and Conflict Resolution - LAOCRC

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of healthcare curriculum
Pass additional competency exam with score of 80% or higher

679c7720-0480-4624-9a79-a40172004dad.description: The digital badge earner develops curriculum and lesson plans for enrichment programming, i.e. music, drama, dance, science club, and academic tutoring for homework assistance. The earner leads small group activities, and implement instructional learning activities to improve student's academic, physical, and social skills. Record keeping and outreach to parents with reports to inform of their child's progress are additional skills.
679c7720-0480-4624-9a79-a40172004dad.name: After School Programs

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of Child Development 037, 046, and 047 with grades of B or higher in each.
Completion of a portfolio with two weekly curriculum activity plans that include art, drama, music, physical fitness, dance, and STEM with a grade of B or higher.
Compilation of a book list with twenty to fifty school age literature books that are multi-cultural and anti-biased.

3f06ba5d-a79d-4793-9594-c3dc9dd752ed.description: The badge earner has the ability to understand foundational medical terminology, the pathophysiology of common diseases and injuries and common pharmacological treatments. The earner can translate basic medical terminology into layman terms and use medical terminology to discuss common pharmacologic therapies, diseases, and injuries. Participated in the LAOCRC Regional Strong Workforce, L.A. Region Healthcare Pathway & Work Readiness Project led by Los Angeles Trade-Technical College.
3f06ba5d-a79d-4793-9594-c3dc9dd752ed.name: Basic Medical Terminology - LAOCRC

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of healthcare curriculum
Pass additional competency exam with score of 80% or higher

9b63d2e6-49c4-4ff7-a700-a5e4c7aba766.description: The digital badge earner can manage day to day activities, develop academic programs for children up to the age of six, communicate progress of the children with parents and other professionals. Earner can hire, train, supervise, and evaluate employees.
9b63d2e6-49c4-4ff7-a700-a5e4c7aba766.name: Child Care Center Administration - Level I

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Child Development 038, 039, and 065 with grades of B or higher.

Write a personnel handbook for employees that outlines job responsibilities, duties, code of ethics, expectations, emergency procedures, and evaluation.  Handbook will be evaluated by a rubric and must reach 80% or higher in standards.

5e19a2d4-add2-46a9-aabe-fcbeb461a3eb.description: The badge earner has demonstrated foundational knowledge, attitude and skills related to recording patient information and performing first aid skills. The earner can accurately measure and record vital signs, communicate accurate and concise patient information through oral and written reports, and perform basic first aid skills. Participated in the LAOCRC Regional Strong Workforce, L.A. Region Healthcare Pathway & Work Readiness Project led by Los Angeles Trade-Technical College.
5e19a2d4-add2-46a9-aabe-fcbeb461a3eb.name: Contact Care and First Aid - LAOCRC

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of healthcare curriculum
Pass additional competency exam with score of 80% or higher

a19abbd6-601e-4e1b-8ccb-6eaea9f19252.description: The badge earner demonstrates the foundations of culinary nutrition including menu development using nutritional standards outlined by the American Medical Association. Recipe and menu development include healthy ingredient selection, low fat, low sodium, diabetic, and super foods. Badge earner develops menus for various specialty diets including paleo, gluten free, dairy free, sugar free, demonstrating preparation for work as specialty diet chef, nutrition chef, and personal chef / trainer.
a19abbd6-601e-4e1b-8ccb-6eaea9f19252.name: Culinary Nutrition

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the LATTC Culinary Arts Pathway Culinary Nutrition Course with a score of 70% or higher.

Demonstrated nutritional principles by developing a 700-calorie, three-course meal, with under 600 milligrams of sodium, 1300 milligrams of sugar, and a balance of all five food groups within 3 hours of receiving the request.

93ee063d-0b77-40f2-ba7b-64460983a754.description: The badge earner can communicate with compassion and empathy via direct and indirect contact for customer service. The earner demonstrates the ability to build positive relationships with clients and co-workers. The earner demonstrates critical thinking to problem solve specific situations involving conflicting points of view. Participated in the LAOCRC Regional Strong Workforce, L.A. Region Healthcare Pathway & Work Readiness Project led by Los Angeles Trade-Technical College.
93ee063d-0b77-40f2-ba7b-64460983a754.name: Customer Service, Compassion, and Empathy - LAOCRC

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of healthcare curriculum
Pass additional competency exam with score of 80% or higher

65cd706a-7abf-4e4d-9794-a4ca31b91dba.description: As a provider of healthcare, the digital badge earner can demonstrate cultural awareness and sensitivity towards diversity. The earner demonstrates respect towards all values, beliefs and customs in healthcare settings. Participated in the LAOCRC Regional Strong Workforce, L.A. Region Healthcare Pathway & Work Readiness Project led by Los Angeles Trade-Technical College.
65cd706a-7abf-4e4d-9794-a4ca31b91dba.name: Diversity and Cultural Awareness - LAOCRC

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of healthcare curriculum
Pass additional competency exam with score of 80% or higher

0a4e960d-770e-4028-b3dd-440fa51aa15c.description: The digital badge earner develops lesson plans with accommodations for exceptional children in various subject areas. The earner is familiar with the law and IFSPs & IEPs, and can implement instructional learning activities that are developmentally appropriate according to the child’s unique abilities. Behavioral observations, interventions and informal screenings can also be applied.
0a4e960d-770e-4028-b3dd-440fa51aa15c.name: Exceptional Children

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of Child Development 044 and 045 with grades of B or higher in each.
Completion of 10 lesson plans with accommodations for different disabilities focusing on developmental levels of ages 4-8 years old.  Lesson plans must each meet rubric standards of 80% or higher.
Compilation of 20-50 resources for parents in a variety of areas for assisting families who are navigating the world of special needs.

9b3fd76b-3688-4c98-8fcd-d1c3a707706c.description: The badge earner can apply purchasing principles to the food service industry to create various types of menus for use in restaurants, night clubs, hotels, catering operations, delicatessens, quick casual restaurants, fast food eateries, and high-end food service operations. Badge earner creates menus that are both satisfying to the customer and profitable to the establishment.
9b3fd76b-3688-4c98-8fcd-d1c3a707706c.name: Menu Planning and Purchasing

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Culinary Arts Pathway Menu Planning and Purchasing course curriculum with a score of 70% or higher.
Successful demonstration of menu development with ordering and costing procedures, and evaluation of the flow of food and sale price.

c95fb05b-7e11-4faf-bf54-bc561503ab46.description: The digital badge earner can demonstrate professionalism, integrity, and ethical behavior associated with healthcare providers. The earner can demonstrate accountability and use of appropriate chain of command. The earner recognizes ethical dilemmas involving patient and team members and uses critical thinking to analyze and guide choices. Participated in the LAOCRC Regional Strong Workforce, L.A. Region Healthcare Pathway & Work Readiness Project led by Los Angeles Trade-Technical College.
c95fb05b-7e11-4faf-bf54-bc561503ab46.name: Professionalism, Integrity, and Ethics - LAOCRC

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of healthcare curriculum
Pass additional competency exam with score of 80% or higher

605ee5a5-7ce8-4370-b7e9-7027b07b3416.description: The badge earner can apply the principles of operating, managing, and owning a food service business, Earner can demonstrate hiring, scheduling, motivating, and personnel management involved in a restaurant or other food service operation.
605ee5a5-7ce8-4370-b7e9-7027b07b3416.name: Restaurant Management

issuer.summary: issued by LA Community College District

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Restaurant Management course with a score of 70% or higher.
Create and present a business plan for a hypothetical food business.

60019f3b-f354-4a9e-9ef0-2c6878ac8e35.description: The badge earner promotes safe practice and infection control in the workplace. The earner recognizes and demonstrates appropriate response to unsafe environmental situations, and documentation of the incident. Participated in the LAOCRC Regional Strong Workforce, L.A. Region Healthcare Pathway & Work Readiness Project led by Los Angeles Trade-Technical College.
60019f3b-f354-4a9e-9ef0-2c6878ac8e35.name: Safe Practice and Infection Control - LAOCRC
